Package ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability

Class TextInputClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.miscservices.inputmethodability.TextInputClient

  • public final class TextInputClient
extends Object
    Represents a text input object. Applications can use the provided methods to submit, delete, modify, and obtain content in the edit box.
    Since:
    3

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      Deletes characters of a specified length behind the cursor in the edit box.

      Obtains the letter case of the text at the cursor position in the edit box.

      Obtains a specified length of characters behind the cursor.

    • Method Detail

      • getEditorAttribute

        public EditorAttribute getEditorAttribute​()
        Obtains the input content attributes, such as numbers, email addresses, and passwords. For details, see EditorAttribute.
        Returns:
        the EditorAttribute of the client.
        Since:
        3

      • insertText

        public boolean insertText​(String text)
        Submits the text entered by a user to an application's edit box through the input method.

        The text is added behind the cursor in the current edit box.

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the texts entered behind the cursor.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • insertRichContent

        public boolean insertRichContent​(RichContent richContent)
        Submits rich content to an application through the input method.

        Rich content includes emoticons and images, which are usually provided by the input method to the edit box based on the content entered by the user. After obtaining the rich content, the edit box accesses it and displays it on the screen.

        Parameters:
        richContent - Indicates the rich content sent by the input method to the target application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        RichContent

      • deleteBackward

        public boolean deleteBackward​(int length)
        Deletes characters of a specified length behind the cursor in the edit box.

        After characters behind the cursor are deleted, the content in the edit box is updated in real time.

        Parameters:
        length - Indicates a length of characters to delete. If the length is greater than that of all characters behind the cursor, all characters behind are deleted. If the length is smaller than or equal to 0, no character is deleted and true is returned.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • deleteForward

        public boolean deleteForward​(int length)
        Deletes characters of a specified length in front of the cursor in the edit box.

        After characters in front of the cursor are deleted, the content in the edit box is updated in real time.

        Parameters:
        length - Indicates the length of the characters to delete. If the length is greater than that of all characters in front of the cursor, all characters in front are deleted. If the length is smaller than or equal to 0, no character is deleted and true is returned.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getForward

        public String getForward​(int length)
        Obtains a specified length of characters in front of the cursor.

        The input method can implement extended functions based on the context in front of and behind the cursor, for example, autocomplete and intelligent analysis.

        Parameters:
        length - Indicates the length of the characters to obtain.
        Returns:
        Returns the specified length of characters before the cursor. All characters are returned if the specified length is greater than the actual length of the characters before the cursor.
        Since:
        3

      • getBackward

        public String getBackward​(int length)
        Obtains a specified length of characters behind the cursor.

        The input method can implement extended functions based on the context in front of and behind the cursor, for example, autocomplete and intelligent analysis.

        Parameters:
        length - Indicates the length of the characters to obtain.
        Returns:
        Returns the specified length of characters behind the cursor. All characters are returned if the specified length is greater than that of the characters behind the cursor.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeEditingText

        public boolean subscribeEditingText​(int token,
                                    EditingCapability capability)
        Subscribes to the text in the current edit box and notifies the input method of text changes.
        Parameters:
        token - Indicates the ID of the current input session.
        capability - Indicates the control capability of the input method, including the maximum number of lines and characters.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getEditingText

        public EditingText getEditingText​(int token,
                                  EditingCapability capability)
        Obtains the text being edited in the edit box.
        Parameters:
        token - Indicates the ID of the current input session.
        capability - Indicates the control capability of the input method, including the maximum number of lines and characters.
        Returns:
        Returns the text being edited in the edit box.
        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeEditingText

        public boolean unsubscribeEditingText​(int token)
        Unsubscribes from the text in the current edit box.
        Parameters:
        token - Indicates the ID of the current input session.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • sendKeyEvent

        public boolean sendKeyEvent​(KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Sends a key press event to an application.

        This method simulates a key press event from a physical keyboard to the focused edit box. Note that the focus may change when the event is received due to asynchronous protocols. This method applies only to the scenario where special keys are pressed, such as the Enter key.

        Parameters:
        keyEvent - Indicates the key event to send.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • sendKeyFunction

        public boolean sendKeyFunction​(int action)
        Allows an input method to instruct the edit box to perform an action based on its available attribute.

        The input method has a key whose function varies depending on the edit box attribute. It can function as the Send, Search, or Enter key.

        Parameters:
        action - Indicates one of the edit box attributes, for example, Send, Search, or Enter, as specified in ohos.miscservices.inputmethod.EditorAttribute#enterKeyType.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • selectText

        public boolean selectText​(int startPos,
                          int endPos)
        Moves the cursor to a specified position, or selects a section of text between the specified start and end positions.

        Generally, the start and end positions overlap. In this case, the editor moves the cursor to the position specified by the input parameters. To select a section of text in the text box, set the start position to a value smaller than the end position.

        Parameters:
        startPos - Indicates the start position of the cursor.
        endPos - Indicates the end position of the cursor.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • requestCurrentCursorContext

        public boolean requestCurrentCursorContext​()
        Allows the input method to obtain the cursor context from the control.

        For physical keyboards, you can use this method to obtain the current cursor position immediately.

        Returns:
        Return true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • subscribeCursorContext

        public boolean subscribeCursorContext​()
        Enables the control to update the real-time cursor context to the input method.

        For physical keyboards, you can use this method to inform the input method of cursor position changes.

        Returns:
        Return true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • unsubscribeCursorContext

        public boolean unsubscribeCursorContext​()
        Disables real-time updates of the cursor context from the control to the input method.

        For physical keyboards, you can use this method to unsubscribe from the cursor position changes.

        Returns:
        Return true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getAutoCapitalizeMode

        public int getAutoCapitalizeMode​(int reqModes)
        Obtains the letter case of the text at the cursor position in the edit box.
        Parameters:
        reqModes - Indicates the automatic letter case specified by the input method. For example, the sentence case, title case, and all caps.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the case of the text at the cursor position is in lowercase; returns the value of the input parameter if the text is in uppercase.
        Since:
        3

      • reviseText

        public boolean reviseText​(int startOffset,
                          String originalText,
                          String correctedText)
        Submits the revised text to the edit box.
        Parameters:
        startOffset - Indicates the start cursor position of the text to revise.
        originalText - Indicates the text to revise.
        correctedText - Indicates the revised text to submit.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • markText

        public boolean markText​(int start,
                        int end)
        Marks the texts between the specified start and end positions in the edit box in English input mode.

        The previous mark state is automatically removed.

        Parameters:
        start - Indicates the start position.
        end - Indicates the end position.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • unmarkText

        public boolean unmarkText​()
        Cancels the mark state of the text in the edit box in English input mode.

        This method is called when the UI is switched, the edit box loses focus, or a space is entered behind the text to be confirmed.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • replaceMarkedText

        public boolean replaceMarkedText​(String text)
        Replaces the marked text with a string of English characters.
        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the characters used to replace the marked text.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
